title: Yo-kai Names
content:
In all Yo-kai Watch games, Yo-kai are stored in .xc archives, under the /data/character/ directory, prefixed with ‘y’.
Yo-kai Watch 1 Yo-kai Names

title: Map Names
content:
In all Yo-kai Watch games, maps are stored in .xc archives, under the /data/map/ directory.
Yo-kai Watch 1 Map Names Yo-kai Watch 2 Map Names Yo-kai Watch 3 Map Names
description:
In all Yo-kai Watch games, maps are stored in .xc archives, under the /data/map/ directory.
Yo-kai Watch 1 Map Names Yo-kai Watch 2 Map Names Yo-kai Watch 3 Map Names

title: .xc
content:
Magic Number (ASCII) Magic Number (HEX) File Type XPCK 0x5850434b Archive This is a general archive format used to compress a lot of the game’s files. All 3d models, textures, armature, and some sprites are stored in these archives. They are identical to .xa and .xk files other than their extention name.
Kuriimu2 is able to extract, modify, and repack these archives.
Tinifan’s Level-5 Blender Addon can export external 3d models into a format that Yo-kai Watch can use.
description:
Magic Number (ASCII) Magic Number (HEX) File Type XPCK 0x5850434b Archive This is a general archive format used to compress a lot of the game’s files. All 3d models, textures, armature, and some sprites are stored in these archives. They are identical to .xa and .xk files other than their extention name.
Kuriimu2 is able to extract, modify, and repack these archives.
Tinifan’s Level-5 Blender Addon can export external 3d models into a format that Yo-kai Watch can use.

title: .xi
content:
Magic Number (ASCII) Magic Number (HEX) File Type IMGC00 0x494D47433030 Image This is the image container used by all Yo-kai Watch games. It supports many different image formats, but ETC1 and ETC1A4 seem to be used the most.
Kuriimu2 can extract, convert, and replace these files.
description:
Magic Number (ASCII) Magic Number (HEX) File Type IMGC00 0x494D47433030 Image This is the image container used by all Yo-kai Watch games. It supports many different image formats, but ETC1 and ETC1A4 seem to be used the most.
Kuriimu2 can extract, convert, and replace these files.

title: .cfg.bin
content:
Magic Number (ASCII) Magic Number (HEX) File Type N/A N/A Data A binary file format for storing data. It is used for NPC/menu dialogue, items at stores, objects on the map, etc. It is the binary form of .cfg files, although leftover files show that they have a few different extensions, including .ptree and .mapenv.
For just editing dialogue, Kuriimu works well. If you need to edit other types of the format, Tinifan’s CfgBinEditor or a hex editor will work.
File Information First off, the cfg.bin format supports 4 data types, explained in the below chart.
Type No. of Bytes Info Example Int 4 32-bit Integer 0x00000001 (1) Float 4 Single-precision floating-point 0x3F800000 (1.0) Byte 1 8-bit Integer 0x01 (1) String 4 Pointer to string 0x00000001 (See Below) The string type just references where the string is in the index, while the actual text will be further down in the file.
File Segments The .cfg.bin file format is divided in to 4 parts.
Unfinished Section Sources Level 5 Bin Files Explained - CfgBinEditor
description:
Magic Number (ASCII) Magic Number (HEX) File Type N/A N/A Data A binary file format for storing data. It is used for NPC/menu dialogue, items at stores, objects on the map, etc. It is the binary form of .cfg files, although leftover files show that they have a few different extensions, including .ptree and .mapenv.
For just editing dialogue, Kuriimu works well. If you need to edit other types of the format, Tinifan’s CfgBinEditor or a hex editor will work.

title: File Formats
content: Documentation on file formats used in the Yo-kai Watch games.
description: Documentation on file formats used in the Yo-kai Watch games.

title: .fa
content:
Magic Number (ASCII) Magic Number (HEX) File Type ARC0 0x41524330 Archive This is the archive used in all of the Yo-kai Watch games, located in the root of the RomFS.
Kuriimu2 is able to extract, modify, and repack these archives.
description:
Magic Number (ASCII) Magic Number (HEX) File Type ARC0 0x41524330 Archive This is the archive used in all of the Yo-kai Watch games, located in the root of the RomFS.
Kuriimu2 is able to extract, modify, and repack these archives.

title: Yo-kai Watch Technical Knowledge Base
content:
This is a site dedicated to documenting the inner-workings of the Yo-kai Watch games by Level-5. The goal of this site is to help with the development of community made mods, tools, and translations.
This site is still very much a work in progress. While I’ll try my best to make sure my or other’s contributions are as accurate as possible, there may be mistakes. If you find something that should be changed, feel free to open an issue on this site’s GitHub.
Special Thanks A very special thanks to: LumaTeam, Tinifan, Woganog, Sofuto, Fan Translators International, Togenyan, TCRF Contributors, YKW Wiki Contributors, and many more I’ve probably forgotten to add.
description:
This is a site dedicated to documenting the inner-workings of the Yo-kai Watch games by Level-5. The goal of this site is to help with the development of community made mods, tools, and translations.
This site is still very much a work in progress. While I’ll try my best to make sure my or other’s contributions are as accurate as possible, there may be mistakes. If you find something that should be changed, feel free to open an issue on this site’s GitHub.
